intro: Stigmaphyllon macropodum, commonly known as the giant stigmaphyllon, is a climbing plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and is often found growing on trees or shrubs in humid, tropical environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
